s.text: So, it may seem a little thing, but imbued with the Orwellian desire to combat imprecise language that makes lies sound truthful and murder respectable, "Today's Papers" would urge the WP to rewrite such stories thus: "..
.whose license was revoked after he crashed into a car, killing a teenage motorist.
The WSJ sees things pretty much the same way, going high with the report's claim that people in cars hit broadside by SUVs are 27 times more likely to die as the SUVs occupants.

The picture helps drive home the basis for the taboo: Behind those Foster Grants Cohen looks every bit the kind of oleaginous pol the Godfather has to eventually help out of some little unpleasantness in Vegas.
